result.execSummary:
The defendant Adolfo Aguallo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $500 fine plus costs on Ct. 1.  (fine/costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted)  To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 2.  Reimburse Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money (costs and buy money have been paid in full from cash bond posted) To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 3 months stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report. If probation is revoked, credit for time served is granted.

for DNA Sample

Defendant Adolfo Aguallo in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reme Bashi interprets for defendant, sworn. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing.    Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Reme will be here to interpret 5/10/16.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Fagundes requests a status in 60 to 90 days. State indicates their offer expired in January.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Adolfo Aguallo in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reme Bashi interprets for defendant, sworn.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Fagundes reguesting courts permission for defendant to travel to Rio Alto, CA 12/19/15 to 12/31/15. Court grants request.
Reme will be here to interpret 2/01/16 at 2:45.

Defendant Adolfo Aguallo in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Fagundes requests a status in January. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Adolfo Aguallo in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sarah Tapia interprets by phone, sworn. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant requests more time to retain an atty. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
by Candelario Sandoval

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to leave Door County without approval of the court.

Defendant Adolfo Aguallo appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 9/22/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 5/12/16)
